title: Petit-Suisse Casino
content:
Hi,

I would like to ceate a new packaging based on the attached design;  
So I'm looking for the "Casino" and "Le Petit-Suisse" fonts.

I think "Le Petit-Suisse" font is Myriad Pro (and all other texts, no?)  
And Casino ?

Many Thanks !!

Font: 

 Tartine Script 

Solved By: 

 [donshottype](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317095446/http:/typophile.com/user/205259 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [ptitssuisses.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317095446/http:/typophile.com/files/ptitssuisses.jpg) | 596.63 KB |
author: doudi

comments.content:
No image that I can see.  
Don

Confirming "Le Petit-Suisse" is [Myriad](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317095446/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/myriad).  
"Casino" is not-a-font, more probably a custom lettering exclusively done for the company.  
There's also [Cocon FF](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317095446/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-cocon/) used on this label ("L'INDICE CARBONE...").

Finally have image.  
I note all of the duplicates for Ryuk's posts.  
I don't know who runs Typophile, but I do appeal to them to try and get better server performance. Sometimes its O.K. More often a post in recent weeks has been like a shot in Russian roulette.  
Don

Ok, thanks for info and confirmation.

Do you have a typo close to Casino to suggest me ?

thanks again !

In the ballpark, I suggest Crema, designed by Hubert Jocham for packaging -- the name suggests dairy, yoghurt etc:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/hubertjocham/crema/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317095446/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/hubertjocham/crema/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/hubertjocham/crema/")  
There are also other buttery scripts such as Tartine Script [http://www.identifont.com/show?27MD](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317095446/http:/www.identifont.com/show?27MD "http://www.identifont.com/show?27MD") that you might find useful.  
Don

The capital M from Gill Sans is based on the proportions of a square with the middle strokes meeting at the centre of that square. The Gill Sans typeface family contains fourteen styles and has less of a mechanical feel than geometric sans-serifs like Futura, because its proportions stemmed from Roman tradition.  
 [seo toronto](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317095446/http:/www.seologist.com/)  
 [http://www.seologist.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317095446/http:/www.seologist.com/ "http://www.seologist.com")

Hope you get the information you want .  
 [earn online](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317095446/http:/www.earnonlinee.com/)
